p: Measles virus (MeV) and canine morbillivirus (CDV) are considered the most contagious viruses among this family (De Vries et al., 2015), and due to the high transmission potential of CDV as well as its cross-species transmission potential, the global health, and conservationist authorities are greatly concerned about role of CDV on endangered species conservation and the possible “jump” from animals to humans (Terio and Craft, 2013; Ohishi et al., 2014). Domestic dogs are the main host for CDV and could also be considered as a reservoir for other mammals (Suzuki et al., 2015; Duque-valencia et al., 2019); however, based on the biology of CDV, humans could also turn into a potential target (Cosby and Weir, 2018; Rendon-Marin et al., 2019).
